title: What abilities do you think the new champ have?
body:
I feel like some really good ideas from just my impression of the animation definitely means he'll be a pain in the ass to fight in the jungle.

Some possible abilities I can see him having are:

* Getting a ping or notification whenever a jungle camp is cleared by an enemy while he's in a certain radius.
* His lines that pertain to, "all you have to do is ask" make me think that he'll be able to receive a buff from a jungle monster from one of his abilities, just as if he'd smote it.
* Definitely some kind of root or stun.
* Maybe some kind of anti-jungler buff where if someone's killed a jungle monster in the last minute or so, he gets bonus damage on them.
* More than likely will be a tank or a support, similar to Maokai. This is one I'm actually kind of skeptical about since we already have Maokai and I think if they went the tanky/support route with him, he'd just feel too similar.

What do you guys think he can do? If you already know, I'd love a link to it.

replies.body:
These speculation threads are always really fun to read through from a dev perspective, cool to see people put together theories (some accurate, some inaccurate) based off the information currently available, particularly when people make some really good intuitive leaps :).

In terms of potential overlap with Maokai that was something that was also on our minds when developing Ivern. We made sure to regularly check that we were delivering fairly different gameplay, visual appearance and personality despite the thematic overlap as a result. Hopefully that comes through as intended, really curious to see what you folks think once he's revealed.

replies.body:
He's definitely going to be a jungler while also being able to play as a support. I personally feel like he is going to be to much like Maokai, and I mean, do we really need another tank champion? Especially when it's already the tank meta? Shouldn't Riot be trying to break the meta to help push the gameplay forward and make it even more intense? 

Anyways, when it comes to his abilities I feel like one of them will be for him to be able to grow a bush anywhere he wants that slows enemies that walk through it and stealths allies. From his video it makes him look like some sort of protector of the forest, a little to similar to Maokai, but I can't help getting the feeling that his passive is that he heals or gets some sort of extra buff when he kills monsters. Another ability of his might be that he can turn jungle monsters into temporary minions of his. For his ult, it's definitely going to be some sort of AOE because basically almost all tanks have an AOE ult, again a little to much like Maokai. 

I also feel that Riot should really start rethinking about how much CC they give their tank champions. Yes, tanks should have _some_ CC but when you give them like 3 different knock-ups or slows they're basically a support champion. Tanks should be able to disrupt enemies but their main purpose is to soak up damage for their team. I mean giving them so much CC is the reason we have people who play Sion, who has 2 knock-ups, a stun, and a slow, as support. Not to mention Maokai who has 2 slows, a knock-back, and a root. 

I just hope the assassin update will finally change the meta. I'm so sick of tank Karma and tank Yasuo.

replies.body: I do know they don't control the meta but they do influence what the current meta is. It's basically been the "tank meta" through, so far, all of season 6 and the last few patches of season 5. That gave them plenty of time to go through the champion and see how they could change and/or remake him without having to go to far from the original concept of the champion.

They influence it because they're the one changing the game. They're the one adding new champions and making balance changes that affects how the overall meta develops. Riot doesn't sit down and say, "Okay, this season, I'm thinking we make tanks the new meta." No, tanks get a decent rework, some QoL changes and suddenly they're the cream of the crop since they've gotten the most recent attention.
